climbs.name: More Than One Way to Skin A Cat

content.description: This fun climb has 4 or 5 bolts to a sport anchor. The climb goes over a small roof near the start (crux). This climb starts up aways, so it's not as long as the other sport routes on the Peta Crag. This was the last of the sport routes to go up on the Peta Crag.
content.location: On the far left side of the Peta Crag.  Hike around to the left to get to the start.  You can also access these anchors by traversing in from the left, so you could top rope this climb easily if you so desired.

content.description: This is the easiest of the sport routes on the Peta Crag. The climbing is blocky with lots of big holds and short traverses, and eventually meets up with I Amimals, They Taste Good near the top.
content.protection: Quick Draws only. Rap or lower from anchors on the top of I Love Animals, They Taste Good.
content.location: Starts right of the arete, on the right side of the formation. Eventually hooks up with the arete near the top.

content.description: This is the crack climb on the right side of the rock.  It is nothing special at all. The Peta Crag has excellent face climbing. The two crack climbs are not the highlight of this crag. The rock is poor on this climb.
content.location: Far right side of the Peta Crag.

content.description: Moderate wide crack up the middle of the formation. If that is your cup of tea, then this climb is for you.
content.protection: A few large cams would probably do.
content.location: Up the middle of the Peta Crag formation.

climbs.name: I Love Animals, They Taste Good

content.description: A sport climb. This excellent climb goes up a corner clipping a few bolts, before cutting out right to the arete and up past 4 bolts and 4 fixed pins. This route took a few days to establish, and was finished on a very cold day in a hail storm.  This is also the first route done on the Peta Crag.
content.protection: Quick draws for the bolts and fixed pins. Lower from an anchor (one pin and one bolt).
content.location: This is the striking right arete of the Peta Crag.

content.description: This excellent climb goes up past 8 bolts and 2 fixed pins to a 2 bolt anchor.  It has fun, sustained well protected climbing on a cool formation in a neat quiet place, with cool views of the valley below.
content.location: This is the bolted route left of the wide crack on the front face of the Peta Crag.
